Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • laptopdeployment.User

  • public class User
extends java.lang.Object
    Object that represents a user

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void assignAllComputers(java.util.ArrayList<Computer> comp) 
      void assignComputer(Computer comp)
      assigns the provided Computer object as the User's new computer
      this is done by inserting the new computer at index 0 of the computers ArrayList
      this ensures that the list goes from newest to oldest when going first to last
      checks to see if current computer has the same asset tag and/or serial
      if so, the computer won't be added
      java.util.ArrayList<Computer> getAllComputers()
      gets all of the User's Computers

      gets a Computer from the computers ARrayList at the specified index

      gets all the machine names of the Computers in the computers ArrayList

      removes a computer at a specified index from the computers ArrayList

      • setStartDate

        public void setStartDate(java.lang.String year,
                         java.lang.String month,
                         java.lang.String day)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        sets the User object's start date using the provided strings
        checks to see if the inputs are valid
        if not, it throws one of a number of exceptions
        Parameters:
        year - start year
        month - start month
        day - start day
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - InvalidYearFormat, InvalidMonthFormat, InvalidDayFormat, DayOutOfRange, MonthOutOfRange

      • assignComputer

        public void assignComputer(Computer comp)
        assigns the provided Computer object as the User's new computer
        this is done by inserting the new computer at index 0 of the computers ArrayList
        this ensures that the list goes from newest to oldest when going first to last
        checks to see if current computer has the same asset tag and/or serial
        if so, the computer won't be added
        Parameters:
        comp - the new Computer

      • assignAllComputers

        public void assignAllComputers(java.util.ArrayList<Computer> comp)

      • removeComputer

        public void removeComputer(int place)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        removes a computer at a specified index from the computers ArrayList
        throws an exception if the list is empty or if the specified index is out of range
        Parameters:
        place - the index at which to remove the computer
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - no computer at selected index
